definition: lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

dozen (loanword)
to swell/swelling/swollen
face/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: If you get beyond your depth like this , it is you who will suffer at last.
sentences.chinese: 你这样打肿脸充胖子，到最后只能自己吃亏。

sentences.english: If you get beyond your depth, you' ll suffer.
sentences.chinese: 打肿脸充胖子，吃亏是自己。

sentences.english: He always did like this to pretend to be a wealthy man.
sentences.chinese: 他这个人总是喜欢打肿脸充胖子。

sentences.english: Many maintain that Britain should give up the pretence of being a busy power.
sentences.chinese: 许多人认为，英国该停止打肿脸充胖子，故作繁忙了。

definition: to go through hell for the sake of keeping up appearances (idiom)
pinyin: si3 yao4 mian4 zi5 huo2 shou4 zui4

definition: to parade one's wealth/to be ostentatious and extravagant
to regard face as all-important/to consider loss of face unthinkable
to bewail one's poverty/to complain about being hard up/to pretend to be poor
see 愛面子|爱面子[ai4 mian4 zi5]
to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
to do (sb) proud/to be a credit to (one's school etc)/to make oneself look good/to build up one's image
to show off one's ability/to boast one's merits
to allow sb to save face/to defer to
(coll.) to show off
to put on airs/to be ostentatious
extravagant (idiom); to throw away money by the handful/wasteful

to lose face
